alert.note: Alert for Albany; Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 17 at 6:49PM MDT until July 17 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Carbon County in south central Wyoming... Central Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 715 PM MDT. * At 646 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Elk Mountain, or 42 miles east of Rawlins, moving east at 35 mph. Expect little to no rain and thunder within these areas strong winds. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Mesonet confirmed. At 642 PM, a mesonet station at CR 402 measured a wind gust of 72 mph! IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Elk Mountain and Arlington. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 252 and 281. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
